title: 111_hr1016
content: The Act titled "Veterans Health Care Budget Reform and Transparency Act of 2009" requires the President to include estimates of appropriations for medical care accounts of the Veterans Health Administration in the budget submission. Additionally, it introduces advance appropriations for certain medical care accounts of the Department of Veterans Affairs. The "Veterans Health Care Budget Reform and Transparency Act of 2009" mandates advance appropriations for certain medical care accounts of the Department of Veterans Affairs starting from fiscal year 2011. The Secretary must provide detailed estimates of funds needed for medical care accounts for the following fiscal year in budget documents submitted to Congress. The "Veterans Health Care Budget Reform and Transparency Act of 2009" requires the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to submit an annual report to Congress on the sufficiency of resources for medical care accounts, including estimates of workload and demand data for the next fiscal year. The Comptroller General will review the accuracy of the VA medical care budget submission in relation to baseline health care model projections to ensure consistency with estimates of resources required for medical care and services. The Comptroller General will review the VA medical care budget submission for accuracy in relation to baseline health care model projections. Reports must be submitted to relevant committees and the Secretary, including an assessment of the review and its basis. Each report submitted under this subsection shall include an assessment, basis for assessment, and additional information as determined appropriate by the Comptroller General. Reports will also be made available to the public.
